results.title: Man's experience of the world
results.creator_credit: Carol Haslam, BBC-TV and Open University
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Social Psychology”.
Two interviews with a businessman approaching the end of his successful career and an occupant of a rural commune to study the differences between them and how they relate to the themes in the unit being studied, ie the Social Science Course.

results.title: Man's effect on the environment
results.creator_credit: Wah Chang and BFA Educational Media
results.brief_description: Shows some of the effects of human exploitation of natural resources from the time of the earliest colonists. Raises questions as to the quality of life such environmental changes might produce.

results.title: Mammals with hoofs
results.creator_credit: William J. Hood and Coronet Films
results.brief_description: Surveys the hoofed mammals called ungulates, including those which are even-toed, such as hippopotamuses, pigs and deer, and those that are odd-toed, such as rhinocereoses and horses. Describes their diets, feeding habits, special adaptations and usefulness to humans. Suitable for middle and uppere primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Mammals and their characteristics
results.brief_description: What do the anteater and the seal have in common? They both have some kind of hair and nurse their young. When vertebrates have these two characteristics, they are classified as mammals. The great diversity of mammals is illustrated by representative members of the major groups - carnivores, rodents, ungulates, marsupials and primates.

results.title: Mammals and milk
results.brief_description: Shows that mammals are all alike in the respect that they produce milk to feed their young. Also useful in early sex education and to stimulate language arts discussion. Suitable for upper primary level.

results.title: Mammals
results.brief_description: Identifies through both common and uncommon examples, those chracteristics that set mammals apart from all other animals. Also shows that household pets may be relatives of large, wild animals. No other credits available. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Mammals
results.brief_description: Presents an early art film by Roman Polanski without dialogue. Shows two men with one sled, tramping through the snow and each trying to out manoeuvre the other in order to ride on the sled. Cast features Henryka Klube and Michala Zolnierziewicza.

results.title: Mama Tina
results.creator_credit: Steve Jeffares, Stuart Menzies, December Films and Gumleaf Productions
results.brief_description: Irish mother Christina Noble has a special identity to the homeless children of Vietnam, she is known as Mama Tina. Driven by her grim childhood in Dublin, Christina moves through the streets and rubbish dumps in search of lost children. The stories related to and filmed by writer-director Steve Jeffares about Mama Tina are a testament to her love for children and her philosophy that all children are entitled to education, health care and love.

results.title: Maltese Flamingo
results.brief_description: A wonderfully wild’n’wacky ski film taking top honours at Vail’s ski film festival. Follow the adventures of 12 ski bums as they take on some of the greatest ski terrain in Europe and North America. Incredible ski action, great music gives `Maltese Flamingo’ the necessary punch to be one of the classic ski films of all time. Rated: G

results.title: Malpractice
results.brief_description: Malpractice is an emotional portrayal of a family’s efforts to come to terms with the result of medical malpractice; and a mother’s need to find out the truth. While most of the characters in this dramatic docu-drama are portrayed by actors, some hospital staff play themselves. The members of the legal profession are all practising solicitors and barristers. The findings of the tribunal are not scripted, but determined by the presentation of the case.
